page.title: 01Abinger Hammer & Gomshall
page.content:
The northern half of the 4x3km block is taken over by the North Downs. The chalk escarpment runs east-west and is predominantly scrub land. The rest of the Downs in this area are wooded with a mixture of deciduous and coniferous trees. The southern part of the block is farmland with the two villages of Abinger Hammer and Gomshall on the A25 running along the foot of the Downs. The presence of the North Downs Way, areas such as Abinger Roughs and Netley Heath make this a popular area with walkers and hikers.
The majority of the farmland is given over to grazing for both cattle and sheep. A watercress farm, however, is situated on the edge of the village of Abinger Hammer. The beds of which are fed by underground springs.
